page.title: 02GARSDON & DISTRICT BUILDINGS
page.content: Many of the houses in this area were built in the last 20 years but made to look old.They look old because they are built of local stone or stone that is made to imitate the old stone.The old stone is usually Cotswold stone and the imitation is usually brad stone. Garsdon and Charlton have more old buildings than Lea including Garsdon manor which orginally belonged to Malmsbury Abbey and at one stage was owned by an ancestor of George Washington. Garsdon and Charlton have more cotswold stone than Lea because they have most of the farm houses in the area and most of them are made of the original local stone. There are'nt many red brick houses in this area. But most of the old sheds are made of red brick. In our area there are only two housing estates, so most of the houses are detached.
